page.title: 19Travel-South Washington.
page.content: Villages in the area are served by buses provided by{The Northern General {Transport}and the{Tyne Wear Passenger {Transport.}These travel into the town centre also to places as far afield as Chester-le-Street,Gateshead,Sunderland and Consett.Buses going to Heworth link with the{Newcastle Metro}and bus services. People travel into the area for work or to visit Biddick Arts Centre which is a restored farm. In the area once reserved for animals there are art and craft shops making pottery,tapestries, violins and other items. In the main building there are cafes,a pub,an art gallery, a theatre and a big room for group activities.There is occasionally a playgroup.Once a month there is an Art Mart. Washington is well covered by an extensive modern{highway system.
